Introduction

GOKI2 stands for GOrilla framework on KIrikiri2. This is a script for creating various games in Kirikiri.
GOKI2 is a framework created by Kirikiri to create various games.
You can also write scripts that are compatible with KAG3 (some are not) by using the included KAGCompatible.gs.


Select the module you want to use first.
Edit /src/goki2/system/construct.gs to select the module.
Load the required modules here.
By default, all modules are loaded, so comment out any unnecessary modules.


Edit /src/goki2/system/congif.gs before creating a game with GOKI2.
First, specify the script to run after initialization.
Edit the following line at the beginning of config.gs.
@que storage=KAGCompatible,testcase
Specify the scripts you want to run in order to the right of storage=, separated by commas.
In the above case, run KAGCompatible after initialization and then run testcase.
If you want to run a script called start instead of testcase, edit it as follows.
@que storage=KAGCompatible,start
You may or may not specify the extension.
For other settings, please check the contents of /src/goki2/system/config.gs.


Furthermore, tags can be expanded by adding a ! mark to a normal tag.
If you specify @!make_character image=WithStand->true,NoStand->false, @make_charcter WithStand If you specify @make_character image=true, it will be considered as specified.
And you can specify a pattern by adding a / symbol to the attribute.
If you specify @!halo /storage=A_<POSE>_<FACE>, it will be replaced with the values specified in the face and pose attributes.
In other words, specifying @halo pose=1 face=1 has the same meaning as specifying @halo storage=A_1_1.
These can also be used in combination.
For @!halo /storage=A_<POSE>_<FACE> pose=pose1 face=face1
@halo pose1 face1 will be converted to @halo storage=A_pose1_face1

Additionally, tag extensions can be specified for each tag name.
For example, if you specify an alias (another name) to the character tag as @redirect alias=halo
If you specify @!character left=m->400, both "@character m" and "@halo m" will be converted to left=400.
If you set @!halo storage=WithStand->bup_halo, "@character WithStand" will not be converted, but "@halo WithStand" will be converted to storage=bup_halo.


A special syntax can be used to specify Boolean values.
For example, if you have an attribute that specifies the logical value ask, specifying @go_to_start ask has the same meaning as specifying ask=true.
Also, specifying @go_to_start !ask has the same meaning as specifying ask=false.


Edit /src/goki2/krkr_autopath.ary to add an automatic search path.
Just create the folder you want to add and add a line with the folder name.
However, only folders directly under /src/goki2/ can be added.
Subfolders cannot be added.
